children: A 22-year-old woman has a chronic pruritic skin condition on the trunk and legs.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Nummular eczema is characterized by extremely pruritic round or oval patches of eczematous dermatitis consisting of papules, scaling, crusting, and often serous oozing. Most lesions appear on the trunk and legs and are 2 to 10 cm in diameter. In contrast, discoid lupus tends to appear on sun-exposed areas rather than the trunk. In addition, discoid lupus typically presents as hypo- or hyperpigmented patches or plaques, with erythema during active disease, which may be variably atrophic or hyperkeratotic.
